==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|じ|yomi=o|ごく}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しごく'}} {{m|ltc|地獄}} ({{IPAchar|/dijH ngjowk/}}, literally “(under)ground prison”). Compare modern simplified {{cog|zh|地狱|tr=dìyù||hell}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|じごく|acc=o|acc2=h|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5|acc2_ref=DJR,SMK5|y=go}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|じごく|hhira=ぢごく}}

# [[hell]], [[Hell]]: an [[unpleasant]] [[afterworld]] where the [[soul]]s of the [[wicked]] are [[punish]]ed
#: {{ja-usex|'''地獄'''に堕ちる|'''じごく''' に おちる|to fall into '''hell'''; to go to '''hell'''}}

====Compounds====
* {{ja-r|地獄道|じごくどう}}: {{sense|[[Buddhism]]}} Hell; one of the six [[plane]]s of [[existence]] in the cycle of [[samsara]].

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|奈落|ならく}}: {{sense|Buddhism}} [[hell]]

====Antonyms====
* {{ja-r|天国|てんごく}}: [[heaven]]
* {{ja-r|天上|てんじょう}}: heaven
* {{ja-r|浄土|じょうど}}: the Pure Land
